DataElement.preferredName: Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group And Karnofsky And Lansky Play-Performance Assessment Status Score
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The number or value that determines the value, significance, or extent of how well a patient is able to perform ordinary tasks and to carry out daily activities based on the Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG), the Karnofsky or the Lansky Play-Performance Status assessments.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of how well a patient is able to perform ordinary tasks and carry out daily activities.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A measure of how well a patient is able to perform ordinary tasks and carry out daily activities.

Concepts.definition: A measure of how well a patient is able to perform ordinary tasks and carry out daily activities.

Property.preferredDefinition: The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

Concepts.definition: The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group And Karnofsky Performance Status And Lansky Play-Performance Status Score
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability for the Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG), the Karnofsky Performance Status and the Lansky Play-Performance Score.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: 100 = Karnofsky scale - Normal, no complaints, no evidence of disease; Lansky scale - Fully active.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: 100 = Karnofsky scale - Normal, no complaints, no evidence of disease; Lansky scale - Fully active.
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: 100 = Karnofsky scale - Normal, no complaints, no evidence of disease; Lansky scale - Fully active.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: 90 = Karnofsky scale - Able to carry on normal activity; Lansky scale - Minor restriction in physically strenuous play.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: 90 = Karnofsky scale - Able to carry on normal activity; Lansky scale - Minor restriction in physically strenuous play.
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: 90 = Karnofsky scale - Able to carry on normal activity; Lansky scale - Minor restriction in physically strenuous play.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: 80 = Karnofsky scale - Normal activity with effort; Lansky scale - Restricted in strenuous play, tires more easily, otherwise active.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: 80 = Karnofsky scale - Normal activity with effort; Lansky scale - Restricted in strenuous play, tires more easily, otherwise active.
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: 80 = Karnofsky scale - Normal activity with effort; Lansky scale - Restricted in strenuous play, tires more easily, otherwise active.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: 70 = Karnofsky scale - Cares for self, unable to carry on normal activity or to do active work.; Lansky score - Both greater restrictions of, and less time spent in, active play.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: 70 = Karnofsky scale - Cares for self, unable to carry on normal activity or to do active work.; Lansky score - Both greater restrictions of, and less time spent in, active play.
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: 70 = Karnofsky scale - Cares for self, unable to carry on normal activity or to do active work.; Lansky score - Both greater restrictions of, and less time spent in, active play.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: 60 = Karnofsky scale - Requires occasional assistance, but is able to care for most needs; Lansky scale - Ambulatory up to 50R of time, limited active play with assistance / supervision.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: 60 = Karnofsky scale - Requires occasional assistance, but is able to care for most needs; Lansky scale - Ambulatory up to 50R of time, limited active play with assistance / supervision.
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: 60 = Karnofsky scale - Requires occasional assistance, but is able to care for most needs; Lansky scale - Ambulatory up to 50R of time, limited active play with assistance / supervision.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: 50 = Karnofsky scale - Requires considerable assistance and frequent medical care; Lansky scale - Considerable assistance required for any active play; fully able to engage in quiet play.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: 50 = Karnofsky scale - Requires considerable assistance and frequent medical care; Lansky scale - Considerable assistance required for any active play; fully able to engage in quiet play.
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: 50 = Karnofsky scale - Requires considerable assistance and frequent medical care; Lansky scale - Considerable assistance required for any active play; fully able to engage in quiet play.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: 40 = Karnofsky scale - Disabled, requires special care and assistance. Lansky scale - Able to initiate quiet activities.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: 40 = Karnofsky scale - Disabled, requires special care and assistance. Lansky scale - Able to initiate quiet activities.
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: 40 = Karnofsky scale - Disabled, requires special care and assistance. Lansky scale - Able to initiate quiet activities.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: 30 = Karnofsky scale - Severely disabled, hospitalization indicated, although death not imminent. Lansky scale - Needs considerable assistance for quiet activity.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: 30 = Karnofsky scale - Severely disabled, hospitalization indicated, although death not imminent. Lansky scale - Needs considerable assistance for quiet activity.
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: 30 = Karnofsky scale - Severely disabled, hospitalization indicated, although death not imminent. Lansky scale - Needs considerable assistance for quiet activity.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: 20 = Karnofsky scale - Very sick, hospitalization necessary; Lansky scale - Limited to very passive activity initiated by others (e.g., TV)

ValueMeaning.preferredName: 20 = Karnofsky scale - Very sick, hospitalization necessary; Lansky scale - Limited to very passive activity initiated by others (e.g., TV)
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: 20 = Karnofsky scale - Very sick, hospitalization necessary; Lansky scale - Limited to very passive activity initiated by others (e.g., TV)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: 10 = Karnofsky scale - Moribund, fatal process progressing rapidly; Lansky scale - Completely disabled, not even passive play.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: 10 = Karnofsky scale - Moribund, fatal process progressing rapidly; Lansky scale - Completely disabled, not even passive play.
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: 10 = Karnofsky scale - Moribund, fatal process progressing rapidly; Lansky scale - Completely disabled, not even passive play.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: 3 = ECOG: Capable of only limited selfcare, confined to bed or chair more than 50% of waking hours.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: 3 = ECOG: Capable of only limited selfcare, confined to bed or chair more than 50% of waking hours.
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: 3 = ECOG: Capable of only limited selfcare, confined to bed or chair more than 50% of waking hours.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: 2 = ECOG: Ambulatory and capable of all self care but unable to carry out any work activities. Up and about more than 50% of waking hours.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: 2 = ECOG: Ambulatory and capable of all self care but unable to carry out any work activities. Up and about more than 50% of waking hours.
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: 2 = ECOG: Ambulatory and capable of all self care but unable to carry out any work activities. Up and about more than 50% of waking hours.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: 0 = ECOG: Fully active, able to carry on all pre-disease performance without restriction.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: 0 = ECOG: Fully active, able to carry on all pre-disease performance without restriction.
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: 0 = ECOG: Fully active, able to carry on all pre-disease performance without restriction.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: 1 = ECOG: Restricted in physically strenuous activity but ambulatory and able to carry out work of a light or sedentary nature, e.g., light house work, office work.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: 1 = ECOG: Restricted in physically strenuous activity but ambulatory and able to carry out work of a light or sedentary nature, e.g., light house work, office work.
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: 1 = ECOG: Restricted in physically strenuous activity but ambulatory and able to carry out work of a light or sedentary nature, e.g., light house work, office work.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: information on quality of patient life and ability to function

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group And Karnofsky Performance Status And Lansky Play-Performance Status Score
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A cooperative group funded primarily by the NCI, one of the largest clinical cancer research organizations in the US, incorporating universities, medical centers, Community Clinical Oncology Programs, and Cooperative Group Outreach Programs with almost 6000 physicians, nurses, pharmacists, statisticians, and clinical research associates from the US, Canada, and South Africa. ECOG has more than 90 active clinical trials in all types of adult malignancies. Annual accrual is 6,000 patients, with more than 20,000 patients in follow-up.:An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.:A standard way of measuring the ability of cancer patients to perform ordinary tasks. The Karnofsky Performance scores range from 0 to 100. A higher score means the patient is better able to carry out daily activities. KPS may be used to determine a patient's prognosis, to measure changes in a patient's ability to function, or to decide if a patient could be included in a clinical trial.:An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.:The play-performance scale for children is a parent-rated instrument which records usual play activity as the index of performance.  It is similar to the Karnofsky Performance Scale for adults.:A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

Concepts.definition: A cooperative group funded primarily by the NCI, one of the largest clinical cancer research organizations in the US, incorporating universities, medical centers, Community Clinical Oncology Programs, and Cooperative Group Outreach Programs with almost 6000 physicians, nurses, pharmacists, statisticians, and clinical research associates from the US, Canada, and South Africa. ECOG has more than 90 active clinical trials in all types of adult malignancies. Annual accrual is 6,000 patients, with more than 20,000 patients in follow-up.
An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.
An index designed for classifying patients 16 years of age or older by their functional impairment.
An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.
The play-performance scale for children is a parent-rated instrument which records usual play activity as the index of performance.  It is similar to the Karnofsky Performance Scale for adults.
A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Released. AK 2020-6-2; 3/12/20 tmt removed PV of 0 for Karnofsky/MM.  1/22/20 - tmt added 1 PV/Theradex, Created to Support Theradex combination question of performance_ghd

DataElement.changeDescription: Released. AK 2020-6-2; Curated to support Theradex combination performance status score question_ghd
